page.title: 18Windsor Great Park
page.content: Windsor Gt. Park covers an area of 4800 acres and includes parkland, beautiful gardens, woodland, Royal lodges and numerous monuments. There are references to the Gt. Park in{the first Domesday Survey}which mentions the enclosure of some of the Kings woodland at Windsor in 1086 . By 1129 a Parker was paid to feed the birds. By 1241 King Henry 3rd had allocated more of Windsor forest and created much of the Gt. Park that is known today. {In the 1980's}the Great Park receives {over 60000 visitors}during summer weekends. They are attracted by the {long walk,}constructed in 1680,{Savill {Gardens}created in 1931 by Sir Eric Savill and{Virginia Water,}dug by the troops in 1789. Apart from walking ,cycling or horseriding, many{joggers} use the Gt. Park.
